Ask HN: Share Your Resume?
text:
Hey all,

------- TL;DR -------

Could you share your resume which got your through the first stage of the job application process for a good tech company.

--- Longer Version ---

I saw a job opening today that I want to apply for. This is my dream company and I don't like my chances.

I'm applying for a backend engineer position, with 3 years of professional experience. In the four after I graduated I have applied to over 200 positions an has gotten through the resume stage 3 times, and that's for a very poor companies.

There must be something wrong with my resume and the thought of editing it gives me a huge anxiety, since it feels like every word I choose can be a deal breaker between hire and not hire.

So, I thought that with a little inspiration and example I could improve it a lot.

Ask HN: Who is using schema driven development at work?
text:
I have been looking at tools supporting schema driven development such as Buf and Fern and I am curious who has seen success with using schema driven development in their day to day work?

I think for the next project I work on I want to try using Buf or something similar (I like the look of dapr, too, but it's not the same thing).

Would love to hear your thoughts!

Show HN: Plane Above Me
text:
Experimented with the new sound recognition SDK in iOS; to expand our toolbox to create cool experiences.

I have always been fascinated by aviation. When an aircraft flies above me, I often wonder: what kind of airplane is it? A 737 or Bombardier? Where is it flying towards? At what speed?

How?

The app uses iPhone’s mic to sense the presence of aircraft sounds. Once detected, it calls flight data APIs, reads out the flight details, show photos of that particular aircraft above you and its current flight path on a map.

Cheers.

Ask HN: Why are there so many spiders in Europe?
text:
I live in southern Europe, and lately (last four months), I have caught and noticed more spiders indoors than in the previous ten years combined.

Most noticeably, they are larger and thicker (about 3x4cm) and usually brown.

Is it just me, or have other people noticed it as well?

Does anyone know if there’s a reason why this is happening now?
